result.execSummary:
The defendant William H. James III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child [Modifiers: Repeater], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  May not have contact with ONS or any person under age of 18., unless otherwise permitted by the agent.  Register & comply w/ the Wisconsin Sex Offender Registry.  Maintain a stable residence.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Same appearances as before:  Clerk: PT
Sentencing arguments made.  Defendant is sentenced to 15 years in the WSP forthwith.  5 years Initial Confinement followed by 10 years Extended Supervision with conditions.  Credit for 252 days.  DE is not eligible for CIP or SAP.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Aileen Henry.  Clerk: PT
Atty Henry requested copy of PSI prior to court and sentencing is set over to 2PM.
received from Defendant

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Aileen Henry.  Clerk: PT
Case is resolved and State is compliant with victim rights notification.  DE pleads Guilty; found guilty by the court.  PSI ordered for Sentencing on 4/29/15 at 11:00 AM.
Email Correspondence from Atty Henry advising she is ill with the flu today.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in custody without Attorney Aileen Henry.  Clerk: PT
Court received email correspondence this morning and Atty Henry is out ill today.  Plea Hearing adj. to 3/18/15 at 1:30 PM.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Aileen Henry.  Clerk: PT
Atty Henry states DE has a revocation sentencing in Branch 3 on 2/4/15 and requests a plea date after the revocation sentencing; no objection by the State.  Plea Hearing on 2/18/15 at 8:30 AM.

Attorney Tracey Braun appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Aileen Henry.  Clerk: PT
Atty Henry states case will be resolved and requests a plea date after his revocation sentence that is scheduled in another court.  Plea Hearing on 1/8/15 at 10:40 AM.
Final pre-trial on November 13, 2014 at 09:40 am.
Due to courts unavailability; Hearing rescheduled to 11/13/14 at 9:40 AM per confirmation with Atty Henry.

Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. Aileen Henry. Clerk LE. Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Request for substitution of Judge Schroeder filed by Atty. Henry. Tab pulled for Judge Kerkman. Bound over to Br. 8. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 10-1-14 @ 2:40pm. to Preliminary Hearing

2:25 pm     Attorney James Kraus appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Angela Komp. Clerk: LE.    Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; set before Comm Mason on 9-4-14 @ 9:45.  $25000 cash bond set with conditions.

*Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *No Contact w/O.N.S. (dob 10/23/98), India S. G-S, or any of their residences.  *No Contact w/any females under 18yrs of age or their residences unless it is a relative of Deft.
